post: ⏳ Final push:  #NationalCivicsBee entries are due Feb 17. Check out this opportunity for 6th-8th graders!  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #MiddleSchool  #Teachers  #Students  #Writing

That moment when students got it, when a debate shifted, a primary source clicked, a hard question landed. We want to hear about your A250 classroom moment in 50 words and enter the weekly Civic Star Challenge drawing for up to $10,000.  https://bit.ly/463KXxf  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #Teaching

Presidents Day classroom prompt: Where does presidential power come from, and where does it stop? Use these short, ready-to-use resources to build constitutional thinking:  https://bit.ly/3M5Fkba  #PresidentsDay  #CivicEducation  #Constitution  #Teaching

📜  #OTD 1818: Frederick Douglass grew up enslaved and did not even know his birthday . As an adult, he chose Feb. 14 as his birthday. How can you use his story to teach agency and dignity this month? 🔗  https://bit.ly/3RWYUos  #TDiH  #BlackHistoryMonth  #FrederickDouglass

Put a primary source in students hands. $25 can give a class a set of Pocket Constitutions. Donate to a classroom near you:  https://lnkd.in/e9WsnNWF  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #Constitution  #K12

If your students could fix one local problem, what would they choose, and how would they argue for it? Thats the National Civics Bee essay. Deadline Feb 17. Apply now:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #StudentVoice  #CivicEducation  #Teachers

📜  #OTD 1809: Abraham Lincoln is born. 4 years after the Battle of Gettysburg, his government of the people…  line still challenges every generation. Use this mini-doc as a fast class hook, what does that phrase require of citizens?  https://bit.ly/405NinJ  #TDiH  #Lincoln  #AmericanHistory  #CivicEducation

Should social platforms require users to be 16+? Have students weigh safety, privacy, and digital rights, then submit a Yes/No/In-between answer by Feb 26.  https://bit.ly/405lfF0  #ThinkTheVote  #CivicEducation  #CivilDiscourse  #DigitalCitizenship

Teachers: your best A250 lesson deserves daylight. Share a 50-word classroom moment and youre in the weekly Civic Star Challenge prize drawing for up to $10,000. Submit here:  https://bit.ly/463KXxf  #CivicStarChallenge  #America250  #CivicEducation  #Teachers

Teacher move: run a 1-class impact kickoff:  Need ➡️ Action ➡️ Result. If students can map it, they can build it. Students 13-19 can submit by May 3 for up to $10,000. What issue would your class pick?  https://bit.ly/3EVuQY2  #MyImpactChallenge  #ProjectBasedLearning  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership
